title: How to Make Banana Gelatin Gummy Bears

steps.headline: Prepare the banana mixture.
steps.description: Gently mash and mix the bananas with the lemon juice in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Add the mashed banana mixture to a small pot.
steps.description: Place the pot over medium heat and allow the mixture to simmer.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat when the bananas are soft.
Blend the mixture with the Stevia until smooth.
Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
Blend the mixture again, along with two packets of unflavored gelatin.
Pour the mixture into a pan.
steps.description: This is a small batch, so you do not need to use a regular baking sheet.

steps.headline: Chill the mixture.
steps.description: Set the pan in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until firm.

steps.headline: Use a mini gummy bear cutter on the mixture.
steps.description: Start at the top corner to make the most bears and least scraps.

text: Prepare the banana mixture. Gently mash and mix the bananas with the lemon juice in a small bowl. Add the mashed banana mixture to a small pot. Place the pot over medium heat and allow the mixture to simmer. Remove from the heat when the bananas are soft.  Blend the mixture with the Stevia until smooth.  Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.  Blend the mixture again, along with two packets of unflavored gelatin.  Pour the mixture into a pan. This is a small batch, so you do not need to use a regular baking sheet. Chill the mixture. Set the pan in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until firm. Use a mini gummy bear cutter on the mixture. Start at the top corner to make the most bears and least scraps. Finished.
